meanings.definition: To crush or flatten something by applying pressure.
meanings.sent1: She was squashing the playdough with her hands.
meanings.sent2: The chef was squashing garlic cloves with a knife.
meanings.sent3: The elephant was squashing the tiny flowers under its feet.
meanings.sent4: The heavy book was squashing the delicate flower on the table.
meanings.sent5: The wrestler was squashing his opponent with great force.

meanings.definition: To suppress or extinguish something forcefully.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was squashing the rumors before they spread.
meanings.sent2: The firefighters were squashing the flames with water.
meanings.sent3: The superhero was squashing the evil plans of the villain.
meanings.sent4: The police were squashing the protest to maintain order.
meanings.sent5: The parent was squashing the child's fears with comforting words.

meanings.definition: The act of crushing or flattening something.
meanings.sent1: The squashing of the soda can was loud.
meanings.sent2: The squashing of the bug underfoot was accidental.
meanings.sent3: The squashing of the cake during transport was disappointing.
meanings.sent4: The squashing of the cardboard box made it easier to recycle.
meanings.sent5: The squashing of the grapes produced delicious juice.
